0410001-d-04-21-89-CR.Primary Accident Cause: Motor car or on-track equipment rules, failure to comply
0410001-d-04-21-89-CR.Accident Cause: Motor car or on-track equipment rules, failure to comply
0410001-d-04-21-89-CR.Narrative: SPERRY RAIL SERVICE TEST CAR (SRS-123) WAS BEING MOVED ON RAIL FROM FRAMINGHAM, MA. TO SELKIRK, NEWYORK UNDER ITS OWN POWER. SRS-123 WAS BEING OPERATED BY SPERRY RAIL SERVICE EMPLOYEE, FOREMAN FRANKW. STILLMAN, WITH CONRAIL EMPLOYEE G.J. COLLINS, EMPLOYEE #756828, AS CONDUCTOR PILOT. SRS-123 WAS OPERATING ON BOSTON LINE, SINGLE MAIN TRACK FROM CP150 TO CP176 UNDER FORM D AUTHORITY ISSUED BY SELKIRK, N.Y. TRAIN DISPATCHER J.P. BABCOCK, FORM D# C203. AT THE SAME TIME, TRAIN FRSE-1 WAS STOPPED AHEAD (HEAD END OF TRAIN AT MP175) WAITING FOR EASTBOUND TRAIN TV-8B TO OPERATE AND CLEAR ON TO CONTROLLED SIDING AT CP176. SRS-123 RAN INTO REAR END OF TRAIN FRSE-1 AT MP 173.67. CAUSE WAS DETERMINED AS FAILURE OF SPERRY RAIL SERVICE EMPLOYEE (FOREMAN) AND CONRAIL CONDUCTOR PILOT TO COMPLY WITH ON-TRACK EQUIPMENT RULES, RULE 812, AS MAXIMUM AUTHORIZED SPEED WAS 15MPH (RESTRICTED SPEED), AND FORM DDID INDICATE TRAIN AHEAD. TWO SPERRY EMPLOYEES INJURED, AND CONRAIL CONDUCTOR PILOT ALSO INJURED. SPERRY RAIL SERVICE CAR SRS-123 SUSTAINED $50,000 DAMAGE.NoneNoneNoneNone
